Articles.Content: I made a thread about a month ago discussing a mod idea, the thread was called "Simplified map view" and was posted in the "General Add-on Affairs" forum, but it seems to have completely vanished from record.
Have you tried clicking on your profile name and clicking on 'Find latest started threads' on the left bar? That has a record of every thread you ever made. Let me know if that worked

Have you tried clicking on your profile name and clicking on 'Find latest started threads' on the left bar? That has a record of every thread you ever made. Let me know if that worked

Tried that. I've started more than 3 threads. A whole bunch of mine seem to have disappeared without any notification or message if they where deliberately removed for some reason....
I can even see my old thread at the top of a google search for it.

I see what I think should be your thread, but it says I do not have permission to view the page. In my experience, it's exceedingly rare for a thread to get deleted, but glitches and mistakes do happen. Maybe Rowsdower or one of the moderators can help?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91763-Mod-idea-Simplified-map-view
It went down the way of the archive. Also, moved.

It went down the way of the archive. Also, moved.

What do you mean "went down the way of the archive"?

What do you mean "went down the way of the archive"?

The support forums were reorganised, and now your thread is in the archive, which I believe is moderator-only viewing. I'm not sure if I'm allowed to retrieve it, maybe a global mod could provide a definitive answer?
It can be retrieved if you want to (as a note it was posted in the Add-on Requests and Support forum which no longer exists).

It can be retrieved if you want to (as a note it was posted in the Add-on Requests and Support forum which no longer exists).

Yes please. I guess you should move it to General Add-on Affairs.

Edited September 12, 2014 by Lucid Hills
